message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper investigates the dissemination of multiple pieces of information in large networks, which is a topic related to network communication and information theory. Therefore, cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.IT (Information Theory) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes protocols for peer-to-peer networks, which involves distributed computing and algorithms, making cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also mentions the use of erasure coding, which is a technique commonly used in data storage and retrieval, suggesting cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the efficiency of the proposed protocols, which is a topic related to performance evaluation and optimization, making cs.SI (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category as well.
